All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class RuleExecutionSetTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

Test the javax.rules.admin.RuleExecutionSet class.

Perfoms the following tests:

  • Basic API tests. testRuleExecutionSet()
    • Create Instance (with and without properties)
    • Get/Set properties
    • Get/Set object filters
    • Retrieve Rules from the RuleExecutionSet
Note:
The tck_res_1.xml rule execution set is used for testing. For more information on this rule execution set, see the TCK documentation.

Since:
JSR-94 1.0
Version:
1.0
See Also:
RuleExecutionSet, TestCaseUtil.getRuleExecutionSetInputStream(java.lang.String)

testRuleExecutionSet

public void testRuleExecutionSet()
Test the compliance for javax.rules.admin.RuleExecutionSet. Get a RuleAdministrator from a RuleServiceProvider and get the LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider from the Administrator. Create a RuleExecutionSet via the LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider. An input stream to the tck_res_1.xml rule execution set is used to construct the rule execution set. Test whether or not properties can be set and retrieved, object filters can be set and retrieved. Iterate through the rules of this rule execution set.

Description:

  • Create Instance (with and without properties)
    • Fail: If any errors occur during the creation of the rule execution set.
    • Succeed: If an instance of a RuleExecutionSet could successfully be created and the specified properties are available.
  • Get/Set properties
    • Fail: If the properties could not be set or retrieved.
    • Succeed: If all the properties can successfully be set and retrieved.
  • Get/Set object filters
    • Fail: If a failure occurs during the set or get of an ObjectFilter.
    • Succeed: If an ObjectFilter can successfully be set and retrieved.
  • Retrieve Rules from the RuleExecutionSet
    • Fail: If no rules are found.
    • Succeed: If at least one rule definition can be found.
